title: Is it possible to add custom shaders / Render states preview mode to the Unity Scene View?

sections.title: SymptomsÂ
content: • I would like to know if it is possible to add custom shaders / Render states preview mode to the Unity Scene View

sections.title: Cause
content: You may want to use a custom shader on "Scene View" for debugging.

sections.title: Resolution
content: Currently, you cannot add a new option into the Render Mode drop-down menu on Scene View. You can however use a MenuItem to add your custom shaders and the function SetSceneViewShaderReplace to load them on Scene View.
With this snippet, you can load your custom shader on Scene View:

[MenuItem("Tools/Custom Render Mode on SceneView")]
static void SceneViewCustomSceneMode() 
{
         SceneView.currentDrawingSceneView.SetSceneViewShaderReplace(Shader, null);
}

content: This article applies to Unity versions 4.1+
